title: PLOS Time series sightability modeling of animal populations | PLOS One
summary: This post discusses using logistic regression models and detection/non-detection data from marked individuals to adjust for visibility bias in detection-only surveys, estimating population abundance.
usefulness_reason: The post mentions "time series" which has a temporal aspect, and "surveys" which directly relates to "Survey data". It also deals with "detection/non-detection data" which can be considered a contextual dataset. However, it doesn't explicitly mention "Spatio Temporal" or "Point Process". The focus is more on modeling animal populations using survey data.
